page.title: 03BIRDS
page.content: Some birds are very big and some are small. Some birds hunt for food like owls, sparrow hawks, and herons. Some people like birds and some do not like birds. Farmers do not like crows because they eat their crops. Some farmers shoot the crows and rooks. When the farmers are ploughing their fields, the crows and Rooks Land behind the tractor to feed on the freshly disturbed ground creatures. The area's most common wild birds are the sparrows, magpies, rooks, starlings, and thrushes. There are still many hedgerows in the area, and these support a wide variety of bird life. The ornithologist Lofthouse made an extensive collection of birds of the area. Many of these are preserved and cared for by the County Museum Service.
